intro: Paracynoglossum asperrimum, commonly known as the rough-tongued plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and prefers well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
